availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. England (Calloway County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Son of Mary B. England. Guardian of R. J. Caldwell. Farmer in Calloway County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1850. Farmer in Calloway County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Calloway County in 1860. Held an additional seven enslaved persons in trust for R. J. Caldwell in Calloway County in 1860. Household owned one additional enslaved person in Calloway County in 1860. Farmer in Calloway County in June 1863. County clerk in Calloway County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 484A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 862.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 365.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, 235A-B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Calloway County, KY, June 1863, p. 12.
"John B England (1823-1905)," Find A Grave, Memorial 25255372, accessed May 15, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25255372.
KYR-0001-006-0083.
